i know... track meets, no people is watching. Soccer, no one is watching but some nice parents. Football, wow, too many people. League? If they have league, a lot people would watch, probably not enough space

I played rugby in Oregon and even still, football is all that matters. Rugby was so much more grueling in my opinion, and I've played both.
North Carolina, you play football and eat BBQ you just do, no one knows why, I don't needless to say i was disowned.

glad im not the only one that feels this way about NC im in the shittiest hicktown there is work helpdesk and 99% of callers forgot to plug in the shitty 100$ pc from goodwill and wonder why it wont cut on, o well i make lots of money off of idiots wanting a pc for nothing at all but checking football stats LOL
Actually my high school is letting us the principal thinks its a great idea and is encouraging us to play and in tournaments
jealous
Thats awesome :)
My school only cares about football and basketball. I live in PA and one teacher wanted to make an HSL team, but we could only find 4 players who wanted to actually compete.
but...but.. i play football ):
^ go home. no one wants you here

Not true. I want him here. There is nothing wrong with playing football, but I wish there would be more support for other sports as well. My high school has won the state championship in multiple sports, but it seems the only one people will watch is football. I wish there was more support for our other athletes as well.

They should make this for Junior High schools too. I'm only in 7th grade and I'm great at this game. I would probably be the champion of the school, because people are so awful at this game. I've been playing for 3 years, probably why I'm as good as I am. {{champion:254}}
#Bronze5

He's actually in bronze 2 jeez don't make fun of him with false information. And his garen page has ap. How is he even lvl 30?

Bro, im in 8th grade, but dont want to let anyone know that i play league, because that is considered nerdy, but i would so love to have a hs program that was kind of secret though.

I'm a Junior Girl, and I tell everyone I Play League because it's super fun. Who gives a shit if people think you are nerdy I told two girls in a grade below me to try it out and they did and love it. I've made so many friends at my school because I did presentations with like Teemo in the background....THEY KNEW WHO SATAN WAS AND IT WAS SO FUNNY! UGHGHYGGYGYUGUY Seriously you don't need to be so self-conscious because once you hit 10th grade you'll realize that you really don't care. But you are young and you mustn't need to worry because you have time to figure things out on your own.

i can't promise it for your high school career, but it usually gets more relaxed on the "nerd" shit. i'm a senior and people play runescape in Digital Design and nobody says anything. But yes, I was in the same boat as you in middle school.

Since I have already seen some questions about it, I wanted to address any East coast vs West coast concerns.

We actually took latency issues into account in the design of this years NACC. To mitigate the issue, we have broken NA into 4 regions (North, South, East, and West). Throughout the qualifiers and into the playoffs, west coast teams will only play other west coast teams and east coast teams will only play east coast teams. The same applies to the North and South regions.

Only when we are down to the final four, and we have the best team from each region, are they matched against each other. However, it is at this stage that the teams are flown out to our studio in LA to compete on our tournament servers.

Is it free for each college to participate?

I am asking because for the first time ever, CSL will not be free.
i dont wanna sound stupid but what is CSL?
Collegiate StarLeague.  One of the community partners involved running qualifiers for the NACC. Find out more at www.cstarleague.com
Every qualifier is free, including CSL.  While some of CSL's other events do require an entry fee, their League of Legends season is completely free of charge!
